ratings.comment: Exams were hard. Nothing from the quizzes was on them. Took forever to reply to emails. I requested a study guide or group studying and he rejected both. Final was 44% of final grade. He curved the exams. You can find the quiz answers online (quizlet). Online class, in person exams.

tests were insanely hard because the majority of the material given was NOT on the tests. not a single one of the quiz questions was even closely related to any test questions. And theres tons of trick questions on the tests. I legitimately studied for the final and got a 65, which is ridiculous for a 1 credit class. Seems like a nice guy though
He can be a hard grader and expects a lot from you, but overall he is very nice and good professor. But if you try, he'll put effort into you too.

Phil is the funniest professor I've ever had. He loves helping students out, which is good given the difficulty of this course at times. He is very good at explaining tough concepts and you can tell how much he loves getting students to understand tough concepts. Go into office hours for his help and it will pay off.

Phil is the funniest professor I've ever had. He loves helping students out, which is good given the difficulty of this course at times. He is very good at explaining tough concepts and you can tell how much he wants to see people learn.

The material in the notes does not correspond to the tests!!! So ridiculous! This is just way too much work for a 1-credit class. He tests you on material that isn't in the notes. Tests averages are around 68%--is curved at the end. Not very helpful either. Very few emails back. No textbook required.

Phil is a genuinely great professor but a bit tough to understand sometimes. His lectures can be convoluted and slow, but he's very clear at explaining things. He does tend to make a bit of fun of his students, which can be a little alienating. Attitude matters a lot, be engaged and excited and work hard while you're in class and you'll do well.

The material provided was completely irrelevant to the midterm and final exam and the style of grading was not revealed until after the drop deadline (set percentages receive each grade). Professor did not respond to emails or hold office hours and he frequently yelled at students during the midterm for no reason. At 1 credit, not worth the stress.

Unsure what is "Easy" about this course. Granted it is a 100-level course but the average on the midterm was a 69. Of course grades are curved, but it is very indicative that midterms are not in line with the material covered-- he wants you to think outside of conventional thinking.

GEO115 is Great!  Everyone should take this course.  It is the easiest two credits you will earn.  You can do everything at your own pace, and everything is laid out very nicely.  Phil is also awesome.  He is very laid back and casual.  Great course.

Phil Brown is simply amazing.  He hadn't taught 202 for about 8 years but still did an awesome job.  When doing exercises in class, he walks around the room and knows when you need help without needing to ask for it.  He makes the more boring lectures interesting with hilarious jokes.  I would recommend this professor to everyone.

Okay...Don't take this class. Should be a nice 1 credit online class. 20% is online quizzes which are pretty easy but then he throws in these stupid trick questions which are just meant to make you go nuts. The TA grades hard... It's not interesting... Bottom line is just don't waste your time if you need 1 credit take gems or anything but this
Phil has an excellent way of describing complicated things to people with little prior experience with the subject matter.  Friendly and approachable.  Don't expect the class to be a cakewalk though!
i was just taking this class for natural science credits--it's pretty much a huge joke and i hated it.  if you don't like science, i do not reccomend taking this class.

1 credit online class....and let me tell you, its harder than it sounds.  The material and quizzes aren't bad (sometimes they sound like they are written for 5 year olds).  But the tests....ridiculously hard!   The TA who grades them is vicious!  For what you think you should study for a 1cr class, you won't get an A...be prepared.

If you cannot ace every quiz, you are a true idiot. All the information is online for quizzes, just gotta find it. Online report for second credit - it'll take a few hours to do it well, but do it for the credit. Not a helpful man (good think ya never need help) and the TA is reputedly evil. Take for EASY, QUICK science credit!
HARD class, very understanding professor.

today i made a snowman in the form of phil brown. and then i admired it for hours. that man is a stud muff. and have you seen his progeny? his sons are 'dec' but his daughter is a fox. p.s. bake him an apple strudel. he LOVES it. with jelly.

i liked his class so much i even recommened it to a stranger in a hot tub in florida.  his name was steve.  he was a pretty nice guy.  so if you have a guy named steve in your geology class next semester tell him i said hello.  and that i miss him.

203 is a very hard class, but Phil as a teacher makes up for it.  He knows his stuff, and though he has a hard time translating into non-technical talk he is always willing to try.  He is also an incredibly nice, interesting guy.  However, he does use too many old slides/overheads.
Online class. It wasn't too hard, but easy to put off until the last minute. Pretty easy A, he curves everything to a B.
This online class is really easy.  Because it's online, you don't really get to see this guy much.  He seems kinda weird.
Sweet online class.  Take for a 2nd credit, you know exactly what you need to do for everything.  Great GPA booster.
